content.html: I‚Äôm quite sure I have, on a hard drive removed from a discarded computer, unread emails that are older than my children (one of whom is 20 years old)
content.text: I‚Äôm quite sure I have, on a hard drive removed from a discarded computer, unread emails that are older than my children (one of whom is 20 years old)

Of course, now I've shaved the yak of deploying bofh.org.uk every time I push to main, a bunch of new yaks have appeared ‚Äì got to automate a few other domains, and while I'm about it, I ought to automate setting up their letsencrypt and virtual host config files too

Note to self: Thursday. Still here. Still on the mend. Trans rights are still human rights.

Huzzah, an email-only domain of mine now has a bofh.org.uk landing page pointing users to resources for LGBTQIA kids in TX and also the UK branch of foo.com

content.html: It‚Äôs the JSON support that inspired me to build jpigd. Skip all middleware and bobby-tables attacks. gitlab.quatermass.co.uk/toolsmith/jrpc‚Ä¶ and then because it made sense, add a JSON-RPC db layer gitlab.quatermass.co.uk/toolsmith/jrpc‚Ä¶

content.html: The website webmention.io holds a list of every(ish) time someone links to, say bofh.org.uk/2022/04/16/we-‚Ä¶. I use N8n to poll that site and adds any fresh mentions to the data files used to build the site, so next time it's rebuilt, I can display the responses on the blog.

content.html: @budley I think I have it‚Ä¶ masto only checks your links when you change or them, so adding the rel="me" link doesn't do anything until you clear and reset a link in your profile. At least, that's my current hypothesis based on not actually reading the code.
content.text: @budley I think I have it‚Ä¶ masto only checks your links when you change or them, so adding the rel="me" link doesn't do anything until you clear and reset a link in your profile. At least, that's my current hypothesis based on not actually reading the code.

content.html:
@budley @dakkar That's kind of frustrating and hard to discover. A 'check my links' button somewhere in the UI, near where it tells you how to add the backlink to your site, would be very handy.

/cc: @Gargron

content.html: @pdcawley so which url points to which destination file ?

content.html: @budley they both point to same file, but the version with the / gets a green link in my profile (because of the rel="me" link back to https://mendeddrum.org/@pdcawley). The link without the / redirects to the the one with it, and mastodon objects to that, apparently.

content.html:
@ConanTheActuarian I've been here a while, that was a crosspost from https://bofh.org.uk/ via https://brid.gy/, which (rather annoyingly) doesn't tag it as such. Which is why I'm now mucking about with https://fed.brid.gy/ and posting blog entries as @bofh.org.uk.

Fed.brid.gy is a tad dissatisfactory too, but at least it's not polluting this timeline, at least until I get it working and start boosting its posts :)

content.html:
Have any of you #IndieWeb types worked out how to generate a #GoHugo post from a commit message? It seems that half of my posts to @bofh.org.uk these days are describing some feature I just committed to the blog's repo. It seems like it might be the good kind of lazy to generate the post from a commits that merge a feature branch or something.

Especially if someone's already done most of the work.

#LazinessIsAVirtue #LazyWeb

content.html: This is breaking my heart. Twitter is literally my main means of talking to my audience‚Ä¶it‚Äôs taken me over ten years to build up this base.
content.text: This is breaking my heart. Twitter is literally my main means of talking to my audience‚Ä¶it‚Äôs taken me over ten years to build up this base.

content.html: Tell me about it. This year I‚Äôve connected to some amazing people on this platform- in a way that just isn‚Äôt on the cards through other means. It‚Äôs a blow right across the board- for big fish and little fish alike.
content.text: Tell me about it. This year I‚Äôve connected to some amazing people on this platform- in a way that just isn‚Äôt on the cards through other means. It‚Äôs a blow right across the board- for big fish and little fish alike.

content.html: We will always have carrier weasel.
content.text: We will always have carrier weasel.

This should be my last thread under the current Twitter regime.

You can still find me at:

‚Ä¢ Mastodon (mendeddrum.org/@pdcawley)
‚Ä¢ YouTube (youtube.com/pierscawley)
‚Ä¢ My blog (bofh.org.uk)
‚Ä¢ Dreamwidth (pdcawley.dreamwidth.org)

content.html: I really appreciate the time you put in to reply to tweets Eliza, and you've really helped with retweeting my Sheffield folk guide stuff. I've decided whilst EM is loosing money on twitter there is no major moral dilemma and I'm staying x
content.text: I really appreciate the time you put in to reply to tweets Eliza, and you've really helped with retweeting my Sheffield folk guide stuff. I've decided whilst EM is loosing money on twitter there is no major moral dilemma and I'm staying x

content.html: Exactly this Eliza. No matter how odious the main Social Media owners are (twitter, FB, Insta etc), some us have to grin and bear it as our livelihoods depend on it for keeping in contact with people. Email just doesn't cut it for interaction.
content.text: Exactly this Eliza. No matter how odious the main  Social Media owners are (twitter, FB, Insta etc), some us have to grin and bear it as our livelihoods depend on it for keeping in contact with people. Email just doesn't cut it for interaction.

content.html: This is awful news... I will find you on youtube, but it's not the same.
content.text: This is awful news... I will find you on youtube, but it's not the same.

content.html: Absolutely. It's too good to lose. I still hope it will all settle down.
content.text: Absolutely. It's too good to lose. I still hope it will all settle down.
